ENG/

Join us for the virtual reality festival Art‚àóVR üöÄ

ü•Ω 31 October - 5 November 2023 at the DOX Centre for Contemporary Art

The program of the Art*VR festival will focus on immersive creation in VR, particularly on empathy in digital media - it is the first event of its kind in Central and Eastern Europe.

The festival will include a film competition of the most important VR projects of the past year, a Zip-Scene conference, and a VR installation Dimension of Empathy, which will last until December 3 and thematizes the relationship between empathy and VR media in relation to several topics - from mental health to the rights of ethnic and sexual minorities to after the climate crisis üí´

Let's explore the dimensions of empathy together in less than a month! üëæ

More information and programme can be found at www.artvr.cz/en/.

Projekt Commander souboru Farma v jeskyni vznik√° ve spolupr√°ci s Centrem souƒçasn√©ho umƒõn√≠ DOX a za podpory Nadace PPF, Ministerstva kultury ƒåesk√© republiky, Magistr√°tu hlavn√≠ho mƒõsta Prahy a Evropsk√©ho sboru solidarity. ------------------------ ENG ------------------------

This premiere of the physical theatre performance and the audiovisual artwork starring child actors will be the culmination of Farm in the Cave‚Äôs artistic project Commander, which explores the online radicalization of children and youth. Both artworks include authentic dialogues taken from real chats of an extremist online group that was run by a thirteen-year-old boy operating under the nickname ‚ÄúCommander.‚Äù

In the audiovisual part, we see these dialogues that happened online transplanted into a new environment: children are saying them while being in common, everyday situations. This clash allows us to see these children in new ways, ways in which we do not want to see them. The children‚Äôs conversations about sex, death, and hate have a chilling atmosphere that balances on the border of absurdity, humour, and unease. On the other hand, the performance, by means of physical theatre, depicts a company of immature adults who play their lives like a game. The performers' dynamic movement, the pulse of live music, and disturbing images together create an unusual insight into the digital darkness that most of us are ‚Äì perhaps intentionally ‚Äì unaware of.

The production bears the distinctive artistic signature of the Farm in the Cave ensemble. Both parts ‚Äì the physical and the audiovisual ‚Äì were created by a team led by Viliam Doƒçolomansk√Ω. The work of the internationally acclaimed physical theatre ensemble Farm in the Cave combines physical theatre, video, film, and live music into a unified work of art and has long been engaged in the exploration of contemporary and neglected social issues. In 2022, the ensemble celebrates the 20th anniversary of its existence.
